satellite_network_attribute_functions.maximum_communication_distance module¶

satellite_network_attribute_functions.maximum_communication_distance.maximum_communication_distance(data_file: str, num_sat: int) → float[source]¶

Calculates the maximum possible communication distance between two satellites orbiting at the lowest possible orbit permitted in the satellite constellation.

Parameters:

  • data_file – the location of the file containing satellite descriptions in TLE format

  • num_sat – the number of satellites in the network

Returns:

the maximum possible communication distance between two satellites

satellite_network_attribute_functions.maximum_communication_distance.satellite_height_above_earth(name: str, s: str, t: str) → float[source]¶

Calculates the height (in km) of a satellite above the Earth’s surface, assuming the satellite has an approximately circular orbit (eccentricity close to 0).

Parameters:

  • name – the name of the constellation

  • s – the first line of the TLE coordinate format

  • t – the second line of the TLE coordinate format

Returns:

the height/altitude (in km) of a satellite above Earth
